subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Sixth Mass Extinction
description: A 60-second lesson on The Sixth Mass Extinction.

hook.text: Earth has had five mass extinctions. Many scientists say the sixth is happening right now.

buildup.text: Species are disappearing 100 to 1,000 times faster than the natural background rate.

discovery.text: This isn't caused by an asteroid or a volcano. It is caused by one species: us.

twist.text: Unlike past extinctions, this one could be stopped â€” if humans choose to change course.

climax.text: One million species now face extinction within decades. The window to act is closing.

punchline.text: We are both the cause and the only possible cure.

quiz.question: How fast are species disappearing compared to the natural rate?
